All Reviews

  1. I come from a family with a long history of baldness. My father and uncle are both almost completely bald already, so I was devastated when I noticed the hair on the top of my head thinning. I can't afford expensive hair implants or surgery, and I refuse to take pills of any kind, so I started looking at other alternatives. Ultrax Laboratories was one of the first that came up in my search. After reading some reviews and checking all the other products I decided on this shampoo and conditioner.<br /><br />The directions say massage the shampoo into your scalp for 2 minutes, 5 times a week, so that's what I did. The 8oz bottle lasted me about two months using it this often. The shampoo has a decent lather, and I found its best to take a generous amount and rub it in anywhere you want thicker hair. It doesn't sting or burn like I thought it might, it actually feels nice. And after washed the shampoo out it left no oils or smell on my hair! It also didn't dry my hair and scalp out, which I was very worried about because I read that some other products could do that. And paired with the Ultrax conditioner, it left my hair feeling as soft as ever! I didn't notice any immediate change after the first uses, but by the third day I was losing less hair in my sleep! So I kept at it and during the second week I noticed little hairs sprouting on the top of my head where I was balding! Hair even started growing in spots around my hairline where they never had before, like around my forehead.<br /><br />After the first month had passed I was already amazed at what this shampoo was doing for me. I've just finished my first bottle and the areas where I was shedding are almost completely filled in with short hairs! I'm sure it will take some time for the hair in that area to be completely normal again, since my hair is nearly 2 feet long, but I am relieved that I don't have to worry about my hair anymore! Ultrax Laboratories is now a good friend of mine and I plan on using their products until my hair is back to normal! I would also highly recommend these shampoo and conditioner to anybody hoping to try and fight their hair loss.ducts until my hair is back to normal! I would also highly recommend these shampoo and conditioner to anybody hoping to try and fight their hair loss.

I leave the product in for about 3-4 minutes as directed and after rinsing, there is no film, buildup or residue. If you are looking for a shampoo that not only cleans your hair but helps it growth and look better, then look no further!

  14. As I searched the internet for products that would stimulate my scalp and promote growth, I found great reviews on Ultrax Lab Hair Surge. Once I read the ingredients, I had a revelation. The word caffeine rang a loud bell and memories of my childhood.<br />My African American mother utilized all types of home remedies during my childhood, even though they were strange; one ingredient worked. The ingredient was caffeine. Twice a week, mom had the difficult task of braiding her daughters’ kinky hair.<br />In the sixties, there was a limited supply of hair care products. The purchase of detangling solution was not an option. Mom solution to detangle my hair was 1/4 teaspoon of instant coffee with warm water. After greasing my scalp, she apply coffee with a hair brush and braid my hair in plaits. The family joke was; our scalps were good to the last drop. Even though my sister and I scalp smelt like coffee on a daily basis, we had a good length of healthy hair.<br />After 35 years of self-inflicted hair damages from braid extensions, coloring, perms and hair weaves, the purchase of Ultrax Lab Hair Surge was the life line that evoked change. I equate, the slaughter of my scalp to misleading advertisements and purchase of at home hair care products<br />For instance, when celebrities endorse hair care products via television and magazines, the power of persuasion wins. Like myself, the consumer makes a purchase. There's a famous R&B entertainer who endorses a product that claim to bring an end to dull and flat hair. NOT! How is that possible, when the famous African American female entertainer is wearing a long lace front blonde wig? Consumers view the illusion and make a purchase.<br />Once I purchased Ultrax Labs Hair Surge, I made an appointment with my hair stylist. During the appointment, the stylist C. applied two shampoos, the texture of brittle menopausal hair was revitalized. The shampoo application brought a cool surge to my scalp and felt so good; I refused a hair conditioner application. After stylist dried and styled my hair, I couldn't believe the transformation. Not only was I impressed with the texture of my hair, C. stylist was also impressed. The only other product she used my hair was oil sheen. Needless to say, C. vowed to purchase Ultrax Lab Hair Surge.<br />I called my sister, who suffers from alopecia and convince her on the product. The scent is also nice; it isn't overpowering or medicinal. Also, when it comes to the effectiveness of hair loss and recovery products, the quality of the ingredients used in the formula is as important as the ingredients themselves, which is what makes Hair Surge a great value.<br /><br />The key ingredients are caffeine, ketoconazole, and saw palmetto. In summary, the caffeine works to stimulate growth and promotes healthy hair, ketoconazole is a powerful anti-fungal and anti-inflammatory that treats dandruff and thinning hair, and saw palmetto blocks the enzyme that is known to be a major cause of baldness in both men and women. These ingredients work together to visibly improve vitality and hair and scalp quality.<br /><br />I'm really glad I started using Hair Surge. I would highly recommend it to both men and women who want to prevent hair loss, stimulate growth, and maintain healthy, full hair!

Unlike some other shampoos, this one does not get very sudsy and foamy when I lather it in my hair. Some of the other shampoos I've used in the past feels like I'm putting detergent into my hair because of the foam and bubbles. I appreciate how this shampoo actually makes me feel like I'm helping and repairing my hair rather than damaging it with harmful &#34;detergent.&#34;<br /><br />NOTE: Make sure you follow the instructions and lather/leave the shampoo in your hair for 2 minutes before rinsing. I think the reason some people may not be experiencing the effect of the product is because they're rinsing it off too quick. The first time I used this, I forgot and rinsed it out of my hair almost immediately, and my hair didn't seem much different. But the next day I left it for 2 minutes and I noticed my hair was looking fuller and feeling thicker. Normally, my hair is pretty thin and flat, so I was amazed to look in the mirror and notice my hair actually having volume!<br /><br />I'm not quite sure how this product does what it does, but I am satisfied with the results I am seeing. I'll have to see what happens to my hair once I run out of this product, but in the meantime, I am going to enjoy my thicker and fuller hair.

I can say that following those instructions definitely produced the best results. I found it to be especially important to make sure and leave it in for the couple minutes. Usually I applied it first and rinsed it last in my shower routine. I find the smell pleasing. It lathers up nice, not super foamy like many shampoos. After using it my hair feels clean and really does feel fuller.<br /><br />Performance: As with any product like this, it's difficult to tell if and how much it's working.   96. This shampoo comes in a black, standard pump bottle for easy access in the shower. The shampoo itself has no color. It's &#34;medicated&#34; and contains compounds known to help with follicle health and other scalp issues that may impede hair growth such as caffeine, saw palmetto, ketoconazole and panthenol.<br /><br />Caffeine stimulates follicles, increases blood flow to the scalp and blocks DHT. Saw Palmetto also prevents DHT from attacking hair follicles. Ketoconazole is an anti-fungal compound and panthenol is a vitamin B derivative that thickens and moisturizes hair. These active ingredients address a solid range of hair growth challenges, so I feel that it's a good formulation. With that said, it has a scent, but it is very light and somewhat pleasant, so you don't have to worry about your hair smelling like a medicine chest with regular use.<br /><br />The shampoo has a really nice consistency and produces a rich lather. Upon working up a lather and letting it sit on my scalp as instructed, I noticed a refreshing tingle. I also felt my scalp lightly pulsate for a minute, like there was increased blood flow on the top of my head. I have sensitive skin, and it didn't irritate me at all. After use, my hair was truly &#34;squeaky clean&#34;. I could still faintly smell its scent in my hair after it was conditioned and dried, but since it's very light, it doesn't bother me at all. I can't wait for my boosted hair growth!

I do feel like I saw a small amount of new growth around the edges of my scalp. I did not feel any tingling, but I do feel like I had a smaller amount of hair loss after showering.   125. This caught my eye because of the ingredients touted on the company's website:<br /><br />1) Caffeine - which can help encourage healthy hair growth and extend the life cycle of hair follicles.<br />2) Ketoconazole - which is often found in dandruff shampoos for its anti-inflammatory & anti-fungal properties, but also helps thinning hair (though the site does admit they can't explain why exactly).<br />3) Saw Palmetto - this is a possible 5-alpha-reductase enzyme blocker; this is important because the enzyme facilitates the change of testosterone into DHT which is a major cause of pattern baldness in men & women.<br /><br />This is how I used it:<br />1) it says to wash your hair 5x, but I don't wash my hair that often so I only used it 2x a week<br />2) the gel is very thick so I used a nickel-sized amount and worked it into my hair from scalp to tips<br />3) I left the shampoo on for about 3 minutes before rinsing it with cold water<br /><br />I didn't see results in breakage and shedding right away so I gave it about 3 weeks and starting feeling a difference. My hair does feel better without a lot of buildup and more luxurious. It was worth the money spent!
  126. Great product. This shampoo is a great breakthrough for anyone who wants more hair growth. It uses caffeine, ketoconazole which is an anti-inflamatory, and saw palmetto which helps against baldness to give you full bodied hair growth. Definitely worth a try.

  130. This is a review that is somewhat close to my heart, more so than other items I have purchased out here. You see, two and a half years ago, I was diagnosed with breast cancer. They told me that everything would be fine, I would just have surgery and a little radiation, and go on my way. Then the tests came back with the news I was dreading to hear, that my cancer was of a type that would require chemotherapy, and Herceptin treatment.<br />The first thing you think of is &#34;Am I going to die?&#34;. After that, &#34;Will I lose my hair?&#34; if not the number one question, it is still very high on the list for most women. Hair loss may seem like a very small thing in comparison to all the other things you have to cope with, and many a time I felt like my priorities were out of whack for concerning myself with my hair at such a time, but the reason it's so troubling is because one minute you look great and feel ok, and the next your entire self is completely transformed into someone you don't recognize. It's very shocking to see your appearance so drastically altered in a matter of weeks, and this transformation drives it home hard that you are really and truly in trouble.<br />At other times in my life, I faked it until I could make it, spent more attention on my hair and makeup to project an image of health and well being to myself when I looked in the mirror, as I am a strong believer in the connection between PMA and the success of overcoming a life challenge of this sort, but this one... at the end of the day you are taking off your wig and washing off the eyebrows you drew on, and the image coming back to you makes it much harder to realize that one day you will feel and look much better. After a year of chemo infusions my hair started coming back, and as it started growing in more fully it came back in these beautiful ringlets. I always wanted curly hair, and enjoyed my beachy ringlets to the max last summer. It's starting to come in much straighter at the roots now though, so I have been pampering what is left of the curls. I still have to take chemo in a pill form for the next 5 to 10 years, what is known as a hormone blocker. I started taking the hormone blockers right after the worst of the infusions were over, and it has been very trying to find a hormone blocker that I could actually tolerate in the way of side effects. I've been taking them for a year or so now, and have been noticing various changes. Now that the curly part is pretty well grown out, and since I have been on the hormone blockers, I have been noticing that my hair seems to be thinning, most noticeably on top and around my forehead. The main cause of thinning in average women is hormonal, and with them tinkering with mine, it makes sense to me that the drugs I take have something to do with it. While in treatment I of course did numerous web searches to find out if there were any way to get the hair to grow back more quickly. While searching, I did find quite a few posts on cancer forums to the effect that dandruff shampoos containing Ketoconazole may help to restore one's hair after chemo. Before trying this product, I also searched for the role of caffeine in hair growth, and there are actually some studies out there about it. I find it reassuring that I can find studies on a variety of sites that suggest this formula really could offer a good benefit for hair restoration, so I am hopeful.<br />I have been using this treatment for about a week so far, I'm still getting acquainted with it, but so far so good. My hair seems fluffier. I have always had very oily hair, and this stuff seems pretty effective for combating the oil and build up. The formula is very thick, and I start with wetting my hair down well, and kind of lathering it a bit in my hands before applying. It doesn't lather the way a drug store shampoo does, and I am still trying to work out what would be the best way to use this treatment. I'm from the tv generation that grew up being told that the way to use a shampoo is &#34;lather, rinse, repeat&#34;, and with the notion that a shampoo must lather in order to be effective. I only lather once with this stuff, and leave it on for a few minutes before rinsing it out. I have also tried it by doing one lather with my normal shampoo, and then using the hair surge. Your mileage may vary :) I do find that it seems to leave my hair a bit dry, and use some conditioner on the ends so I can comb it out and style it more easily. It doesn't seem like I need to use very much of this at all, and my hair looks good today. I'm glad to have given it a try, it's too soon to tell if it will help my hair grow, but I do find improvement in the fullness and texture of my hair, and can't wait to see how my hair is at the end of a month of treatment :)ion that grew up being told that the way to use a shampoo is &#34;lather, rinse, repeat&#34;, and with the notion that a shampoo must lather in order to be effective. I only lather once with this stuff, and leave it on for a few minutes before rinsing it out. I have also tried it by doing one lather with my normal shampoo, and then using the hair surge. Your mileage may vary :) I do find that it seems to leave my hair a bit dry, and use some conditioner on the ends so I can comb it out and style it more easily. It doesn't seem like I need to use very much of this at all, and my hair looks good today. I'm glad to have given it a try, it's too soon to tell if it will help my hair grow, but I do find improvement in the fullness and texture of my hair, and can't wait to see how my hair is at the end of a month of treatment :)

I have been using the Hair Solace conditioner(also by Ultrax), along with this shampoo and the two products together are making a tremendous improvement. It has only been two weeks, so I am excited to see continued improvement as I continue using this product. I was skeptical at first, but now I believe. This stuff works. I recommend the conditioner as well. I have not had time to write a review on that yet, but I will give it 5 stars.

  261. 30 yr old male, lived with proceeding male pattern baldness since about 22 or 23 years of age. Figured I'd rather live the last 20 yrs of my life with no hair than the first 20 with hair. Have dutifully applied this almost every morning since mid August 2014 to now mid-December 2014, so 4 months total. Apparently my genetics are stronger than this formula. I applied the shampoo, scrubbed and massaged it for about 30 seconds and then sit and wait with my head lowered so it wouldn't run off, counting out 2 long minutes then rinsed. I have exercised consistently, discovered I had hypothyroidism which I have been treating 2 months now, eaten better foods, tried sleeping better, with no results. I have grown the sides out more and leftover hair on top to provide a comfortable comb over but no results in 4 months. I'll finish off my bottle of what's left and try Rogaine or something. Oh, no tingling effect with this shampoo either. Maybe your genetics are better suited to this product than mine, but my genetics or thyroid issues...whatever it is, it is too powerful for this product.

That way not only do I &#34;feel&#34; like it's clean (since we all associate a good lather with clean hair), but it also retains the same smell I like, AND all the benefits from this amazing shampoo!   383. Ultrax Labs Hair Surge is a great shampoo for those that are experience mild to moderate hair loss. I was given a bottle for free to try and review, and I really liked it. I found the lather-level to be moderate, which gives a great clean feeling, but is still easy to rinse out. For those that have never used this before, read the directions! You’ll need to leave this in for up to 2 minutes before rinsing for it to work. This is a daily-use shampoo, so plan on using it every time you shower in order to see results. Even after just a couple of uses, there appears to be less hair in the brush.<br /><br />The shampoo is packaged in an 8-ounce bottle and it has a pump top. The pump helps reduce the amount used, so the bottle does last for a while, despite its small size. You really don’t need a lot of this shampoo for it to clean hair and work. When applying, focus on the scalp, as that’s where the hair grows from. The shampoo contains caffeine, and there’s a slight (though pleasant) tingle when you massage it in. The shampoo has a light, almost citrus scent to it that would be nice for men or women. It doesn’t smell medicated, like other hair stimulating shampoos do. ''<br /><br />Although this probably isn’t a factor for most people looking for hair-loss shampoo, the product is made in the U.S. and comes in a recyclable bottle. The recycling code is 1, for those with limited recycling facilities.

Sometimes my hair fall is caused by stressors during my night shifts at the hospital as a Nurse.<br /><br />As I age, hair loss has become more of a problem for me-I am allergic to many artificial scents and strong scents so am kind of afraid to give this a try, but my husband bought it anyway for me.<br /><br />Experiencing hair fall on a daily basis is something normal to most people. It is even normal to shed 10’s or hundreds of strands each day as part of the hair growth cycle but do remember that beyond that number would not be consider normal anymore. Exceeding more than a hundred strands per day would be called excessive hair loss and it can be from numerous things such as hereditary disorders, illness, major surgery, hormonal problems, child birth and delivery, medication and infections, too.<br /><br />What I need to work on, is its prevention. Remember that in terms of hair loss, keeping the hair and scalp clean is very important in preventing hair fall. Some hair loss has something to do with medication you take in. Some could be due to infection or any fungal scalp condition. What you can do is either checked in with your doctor or you may use shampoo or scalp lotion that provides nourishment to your scalp – stopping hair fall and stimulate hair growth.<br /><br />I found this particular shampoo very helpful to me. While it is not reasonably as expensive as my usual treatment shampoo, It’s quite nourishing and untangles my hair without using a conditioner!   425. This Ultrax hair shampoo has been a disaster for me. I want to start this by saying that my experience is not necessarily what your experience will be. If the 5 star reviews are to be trusted, this has worked extremely well for some people.<br /><br />However, it has been worse than ineffective for me. I have been losing hair for 3 years at a steady, but noticeable rate. My scalp was started to really show to the right and left side of my slight widow's peak, along the slope where the top of my head meets the side of my head.<br /><br />I started using Ultrax a few months ago, and I immediately saw a change after using it... within a week, about 25% of my hair had fallen out along this area of my head. My logic to keep with it was that, like monoxidil, caffeine would be increasing the blood flow to my follicles. This can cause hair that is in a certain stage (starved of enough nutrients) to fall out, which will normally then be replaced by new, healthier hair follicles. However, months later, no new hair has grown back.<br /><br />In fact, 50% of the hair that I started with in the aforementioned areas has fallen out. It is my worst nightmare. I've finally stopped it altogether because it is now clear this product is not only NOT helping, but it is making it significantly worse. Basically, if I were to judge my hair loss in the last three years, I'd say that I lost 3 more years of hair in the span of 3 months.<br /><br />I wanted everyone to be aware that... somehow - I don't know how... this product can have the reverse effect of what it is designed to do. I am a health 27 year old male, and am active, and no one on my mother's side of the family has hair-loss issues (supposedly mother's side is where we get hair-loss genes). So I may be the extremely unlucky case here.<br /><br />Just because this happened to me doesn't necessarily mean this will happen to you, and that you shouldn't buy this product. Please don't let me destroy this product for you. But also, please keep my results in mind.

I researched the ingredients thoroughly and in fact caffeine seems to be a very common ingredient in products intended to revitalize hair, or help replenish hair loss through fall out (not my problem at all, but rather re-texturizing hair damaged due to years of coloring). The scent is a bit antiseptic/minty due to the menthol and peppermint oil in the treatment. Product also contains niacin (also good for healthy nails), panthenol(s) and saw palmetto, all known ingredients in hair revitalization formulas, as well as something called ketoconazole, which in my research seemed to be a frequent suggestion in hair loss forums as something that actively promotes hair growth. Whether you're trying to bring back a healthy texture to your hair, or wanting to try a new hair regrowth product, this one seems to be a good bet.

What wasn't realized until recently is just how powerful this ingredient can be for people with thinning hair. While the exact mechanisms in how it works aren't know, there are ongoing studies that are attempting to pinpoint exactly whats makes ketokanazole so potent. Hair Surge contains 0.2% Ketoconazole.<br /> • Saw Palmetto - Clinical trials have shown that Saw Palmetto may block an enzyme, 5-alpha-reductase, which facilitates the change of testosterone into DHT. DHT is considered a major cause for both mail and female pattern baldness.&#34;<br />.....I knew I wanted to try it.<br /><br />I'll update in a month when I should be nearing the end of the bottle, but so far I am seeing results(hair regrowth/stimulation) and no longer using Minoxidil based products.<br /><br />Also note that I suffer from male pattern baldness, centrally, so I can't comment on what it's doing to the side and back of my head yet(maybe it'll get more fuller).   730. Many people fail to realize that there is a big difference in shampoos. First of all, professional shampoos, such as Ultrax Labs Hair Surge, are concentrated, not watered down. That means you use less of the product. Professional shampoos lather less than you might expect because they are free from sulfates, but you don't need lather to do a great job of shampooing. So don't expect lots of lather with this product. Hair Surge has a faint pleasant aroma,without being overwhelming. I have used the product just once, but it seems like it has great promise. My only complaints are with the directions. Like most shampoos, you are directed to lather. Unlike most shampoos, there is no direction to rinse well.
  731. Hair Surge Caffeine Hair Loss Hair Growth Stimulating Shampoo by Ultrax Labs of course cost a bit more due to the specialized ingredients such as Ketoconazole (anti fungal) and Saw Palmento. which are shown to help grow hair to it's fullest potential. I've been using this for a bit and I am impressed. As with any premium shampoo, you do not need a lot, (one pump will do it) and it does not lather a lot, but my hair is so clean and soft and the fragrance is slightly citrus and not overwhelming and does not linger so it will not clash with any fragrance you may wear. I have noticed less hair in both the drain and in my hairbrush which is very encouraging. I also color my hair and this shampoo has left my hair very manageable. I would shampoo my hair normally with this for its lather and cleansing properties. Then I would rinse it out. THEN I would apply the Hair Surge shampoo. The residue from the previous shampoo would help the Hair Surge shampoo lather my scalp. I would then leave the Hair Surge shampoo on my scalp while I soaped up my body.   844. This is a great product! To begin, the company, Ultrax Labs offer a 90-day money back guarantee -- that's unheard of in this day and age, and speaks volumes about their confidence in their product. Another thing that jumps out is it's one of the few caffeinated shampoos (more on that in a minute) that is formulated for both men and women. There are three key ingredients in this shampoo: caffeine, which research shows can extend the life of the hair follicle by decreasing the release of the hormone DHT, which suppresses the growth of hair follicles. Ketoconazole, an anti-fungal to help control dandruff, but has also been found in a study published in the Journal of Dermatology to stimulate hair growth. And, finally, Saw Palmetto, which is used to block an enzyme that converts testosterone into DHT. If you want to halt hair loss and stimulate hair growth, go with natural ingredients that this shampoo offers over other products that are full of chemicals!

So I was stunned to discover that an over the counter shampoo might be the answer to my fairly recent hair thinning and slow growth issues. I began using Ultrax Labs Hair Surge Shampoo about 30 days ago, and after 12 shampoos, the excessive breakage has stopped, and thinning hair on the scalp has started to fill in a bit. It hasn't all filled in at this stage, but I'm fairly confident all of it will. After sharing my experiences with a friend about Hair Surge, we got into a friendly debate as to why the product works. One of us thinks it is because it minimizes hair breakage and strengthens the hair which leads to longer hair, and the other suggests Hair Surge stimulates the scalp to rejuvenate old hair follicle cells to grow new hair. I quite think the product does a bit of both. All debating aside, the bottom line is when I inspect my scalp where the thinning is prevalent, I now see hairs coming up where there were none before. And I probably wouldn't have believed this were possible had I not added Hair Surge to my weekly shampoo routine and experienced results first hand. Anyone truly interested in evaluating the product shouldn't debate its effectiveness, they should try it for themselves. Because we all know our own hair and scalp better than anyone, even the most subtle changes in hair growth will be detected, making debate about the products effectiveness irrelevant.   917. This is my first review on Amazon. Like everyone here, I purchase many products on Amazon based on positive user reviews. The reason I am taking the time to write my first review is to help end the debate on whether or not the reviews written for this product are in fact real or fake. Well here is a REAL review:<br /><br />I am a 28 year old male with minimal thinning at the temples (more so on my left). I started noticing thinning about 2 years ago and I wanted to find a simple solution that would help. Searching on Amazon I typed in 'hair growth' and found this product with great ratings and reviews so I figured why not give it a try.<br /><br />When the shampoo first arrived I noticed the bottle is extremely small for the price paid. Now, when using it in the shower I noticed how poorly it lathered up. In order to lather it up the way any other typical shampoo does, it would take you 5 or more pumps of this shampoo which is a lot given its small size. So all those reviews that say it lathers up well, that's simply not true. Due to the fact it does not lather up well and because I use strong hair gel, I learned I am not able to only use this shampoo alone otherwise I will shed more than usual. Because of this, I first wash my hair with a thickening shampoo. I rinse then apply 1 pump of Hair Surge. I find that at this point my hair is more slick and does not shed. After I gently rub in Hair Surge into my scalp, I try to let it stay in for 2-5 minutes. At this time I rinse and always notice my hair feels lively and smooth. It does in fact feel like its been stimulated due to the fact it feels thicker and pops out of my scalp. It is hard to describe, but something is definitely working. In regards to its claim of hair growth, in the first week of use I noticed 3 new hairs appear near my left temple which was great since I only used the product for a few days. Besides that there hasn't been much hair growth but I do feel it has slowed down my hair loss. I have only purchased 1 shampoo and it has lasted me about 2 months. Although the shampoo has many positives as mentioned, I am unsure if I will be purchasing another bottle due to its price. In conclusion, if you have the money then I recommend purchasing this product and giving it a try.<br /><br />I hope this review has helped!

I could usually run my fingers through my hair and easily find about 5 hairs on my palm EVERY TIME I ran my fingers through my hair. After three weeks, no matter how many times I run my fingers through it, I'm hard pressed to find even a single hair plucked out of my head. This is already a very noticeable difference. The week after, finishing off my first month of use, I started to notice my bald spots on my crown starting to fill out and in dramatic fashion. Everyday I've been excited to look in the mirror since to find that the bald spots are becoming harder and harder to notice as the hairs covering the spots are becoming more prevalent and darker. The initial excitement has lead me to write this review which I never do. I figured you have to take a shower, (or rather one should), everyday anyway, I might as well keep using it every time. It seems to last quite a while anyway because I only need one pump to have enough of the product to cover my head probably because I have short hair. This is probably why it lathers so easily for myself as opposed to some who say that it's hard to spread and work into a lather; their hair is probably much longer and/or fuller than mine.<br /><br />The Hair Lush Serum I use right after taking a shower. I need to use two pumps from the bottle to be able to have enough to use on my head. The whole process of using the shampoo and the serum all take place at night but I do however use the serum one other time in the morning before I go to work. This regiment worked for me. I've gone through about 5 different products though out the years, including Rogaine which I was allergic to, and now I finally found something that works.

Why not try it? Also, Hair Surge contains ingredients beneficial to growing and maintaining healthy hair. Those are essential oils -- important for conditioning and moisturizing hair -- and caffeine compounds known to stimulate hair follicles so hair grows faster and to extend the hair lifecycle. The ingredient Ketoconazole, stunts hair loss by blocking testosterone, and another key ingredient, saw Palmetto, increases hair density. Like anything, it does take time and consistent usage and patience to see results. I have been using it for a month now and I am really starting to see a difference.

  1149. This medicated shampoo is the best product I've tried to halt my hair loss and keep my scalp healthy. In the past I've used prescription products which were only disappointing and expensive. My thinning hair has been progressively oily, wiry fine, and so brittle. Worse, plenty of relentless shedding with no hair regrowth in ever expanding sections. Fortunately, I finally tried this shampoo and normally use just a small amount five days a week for my hair loss with some positive developments so far. The most obvious is I'm keeping more of my hair now with some areas in the back growing longer, while the hairs are visibly thicker. And my fiance' affirms she notices fewer hairs on our pillows and in the bathroom. She would know. I think the key is this formula does a great job of solving my oily scalp breakouts that, I suspect, are responsible for my hair follicle deterioration. No more itchy/flaky scalp and overall, I think, more healthful, since that oil that oozes out has mostly ceased or is cleared away by this shampoo when it does erupt. I'd say this has to be conducive to hair growth in itself. I'm satisfied that right now it allows me to maintain what I do have and confident, based on what I'm seeing so far, with long term use it will allow me to regrow fuller hair.

  1316. Hair Surge shampoo comes in an 11.2-ounce bottle, not much smaller than the standard 12.5-ounce container used for many hair cleansing products. Like many quality shampoos, Hair Surge has a thick, silky consistency and fresh, clean scent that is not overpowering. The shampoo glides on the hair strands during application. It rinses off with ease, leaving the hair feeling soft and conditioned.<br /><br />This Ultrax Labs’ shampoo, which is relatively new to the market, is designed for men and women coping with hair thinning and loss. Though it cost more than the basic, non-specialized hair cleansers, its price fits within the average range for similar hair-loss shampoos.<br /><br />Hair Surge contains ingredients beneficial to growing and maintaining healthy hair. Those are essential oils -- important for conditioning and moisturizing hair -- and caffeine compounds known to stimulate hair follicles so hair grows faster and to extend the hair lifecycle.<br /><br />Ketoconazole and Saw Palmetto are two other important components in this shampoo. Ketoconazole is an anti-fungal commonly used to treat dandruff, but that also stunts hair loss by blocking testosterone. Saw Palmetto, which has a long history in herbal medicine, increases hair density.<br />It requires time, consistent usage and patience to see results, especially when using products designed to reverse long-term effects. But the ingredients, along with Ultrax Labs’ 100% satisfaction guarantee, make this shampoo a winner worth trying.

These essential oils are important for conditioning and moisturizing hair and caffeine compounds known to stimulate hair follicles so hair grows faster. Two other important additions are Ketoconazole and Saw Palmetto. Ketoconazole is an anti-fungal usually used to treat dandruff, but it also stunts hair loss by blocking testosterone. Saw Palmetto, which has a long history in herbal medicine, increases hair density. Hair Surge foams to a nice lather, doesn't have a weird chemical smell, and since I have short hair the 11 oz bottle seems to be lasting quite a while. I'm sure if you have long hair the number of uses might change. It's recommended to keep on for 2-3 minutes like you would a regular conditioner, and when I rinse it off my head and hair feel clean and fresh, not oily. I would recommend this for sure, it's a bit more expensive than regular shampoo, but you get what you pay for. Totally worth it in my opinion :-)

  1484. Wanting beautiful, silky, luxurious hair is natural. However, beauty is overrated, as is its price tag. Wouldn't you rather get the best results for as little money as possible? In my opinion, relying on stupidly expensive \\"miracle\\" shampoos, conditioners, and supplements is a waste of time and hope. Yes, I'm saying this shampoo (Ultrax or whatever) is a waste. You're better off going all natural, since the shampoos and conditioners you've been using all your life have been clogging your hair and making it filthier. They've also made you addicted to them. Ever notice how your hair gets greasy only a day or two after shampooing? That's because the ingredients are designed to keep you coming back for more, to force you to wash every single night. Companies make more money that way. Just think about it, no one had to worry about this crap a hundred years ago. Why? Because their hair didn't get all goopy within 24 hours after taking a bath! For dogs, it takes a few months before their hair needs attention. We're the ones who have been duped. This is my solution: wash your hair using a baking soda paste and to condition it, use apple cider vinegar. This sounds weird, but believe me when I say it seriously cleans your hair, and not only that, but it feels and looks awesome. The first time I did this, my hair was so light and fluffy. I was amazed when I ran my fingers through my wet hair because they went through so easily. The idea is to stop using shampoos and conditioners, and instead wash your hair occasionally using baking soda and apple cider vinegar. Right now, I can go an entire week before I need to clean my hair (I do rinse my hair every night). Please don't be grossed out. My hair doesn't get greasy for the whole week. Seriously. No kidding. Eventually I wont need to do it nearly that much. Here is a link to a great article that will explain everything: http://thehairpin.com/2011/04/how-to-quit-shampoo-without-becoming-disgusting The author is funny andwill tell you step by step how to do this. As far as hair regrowth goes, you could always creat your own creams. Find some liquid caffeine online or at a health food store, add some other liquid or powder ingredients that are great for hair growth and apply it. You don't need to spend so much money on a shampoo that may or may not work for you. Plus, this way you really know what you're putting on your skin. I hope this helps someone. You might also consider making your own toothpaste, deodorant and dishwashing / clothes detergents. Finding recipes online is easy and the recipes are always simple and usually quick. This will also save you money in the long run. I make all of these myself. (Just this week I made my own deodorant and it works better than anything store bought.)

  1501. (Update after three months of usage) this product, believe it or not, DOES work for minor hair loss or thinning. It's not a miracle cure or anything so keep that in mind while reading the review. The shampoo contains a few ingredients which are recognized to aid in treating hair loss, such as Sawtooth Palmetto and Keta. I used one or two pumps a day, ~5 times a week (the suggested amount of usage). It should be noted, my hair loss wasn't considered major, it was mostly just some thinning towards the crown and barely noticeable recession. All my hair felt less dense. Here's a pretty decent timeline of happenings: First use - hair immediately felt stronger and thicker. I imagined this was a short term cosmetic implication, like using some kind of product to make your hair _look_ thicker. Either way, it felt and looked good Two weeks in - at this point, I noticed while washing my hair that very few hairs came out. Much less than usual. Instead of maybe 10 little hairs, I'd see about 1. I'd shed less in general, too. This was the first big surprise to me, that it was actually working One month - I noticed my hair started to feel denser. It looked more \\"balanced\\" in growth; instead of having any patchy growth (loose around the crown, dense on back and sides), every area seemed to be growing roughly equally, which was a noted change Two months - anyone with thinning knows it's very apparent when your hair is wet. Now, while wet, the patchy areas began closing up and becoming consistent all around. Three months - hair had reached the point where I forgot there was even originally a problem. I use this regularly now and love it so yes, it does work, and I would recommend it. As for other details, it smells... okay. Not good, not bad. Citrusy with a kind of chemical-like undertone. The amount that you get in the bottle can last a pretty good 2 months, depending on how often and how much you use it. I used the recommended dose from the instructions
  1502. For a senior citizen, I thought my hair was pretty healthy - fairly thick, full, with just the smallest of a receding hairline.   1536. Ultrax Labs Hair Surge is a fantastic and highly innovative product. Ultrax Labs has created a unique formula, which includes caffeine, ketoconazole, and saw palmetto. Caffeine promotes hair growth by stimulating the follicles in your scalp. Ketoconazole is an antifungal that repairs fungal or bacterial causes of an unhealthy scalp, including dandruff. Saw palmetto blocks an enzyme that causes hair loss. Combined, these active ingredients not only promote hair growth, hair quality and scalp vitality, but they also prevent hair loss. This product essentially combats hair loss at both ends, which is what makes it so effective. And unlike other hair growth shampoos, Hair Surge actually smells good! The second week I thought I felt some baby hairs coming in but thought my imagination may have been getting the best of me. The third week I really noticed results. My thinness on the top of my head and back by the 'bald spot' are noticeably thicker. I can tell when I run my fingers through my hair or use a hair brush.<br /><br />I am more than satisfied with this product and will be purchasing more when I run out. I will also post a future review if it stops working or I see any different results. Cheers!

  1666. This shampoo has a pleasant smell, not overly fragrant. It comes in a slow-pump bottle designed to prevent too much shampoo dispersing at once. The serum is clear in color.<br /><br />To use, apply a generous amount to your hair, paying special attention to your scalp. This is very simple to apply. Massage shampoo in as best as possible, and leave on for about 5 minutes. Then be sure to rinse the solution thoroughly from your hair. The shampoo does not create a rich, soapy lather, but feels more like a gel when applied to your hair. Be sure to moisturize with conditioner or Argan oil afterward, it does slightly dry out your locks.<br /><br />This works great and I noticed fuller, more bodied hair after using this for about a week or so.
